title: MRI to FDG-PET: Cross-Modal Synthesis Using 3D U-Net for Multi-modal Alzheimer’s Classification
title-short: MRI到FDG-PET：使用3D U-Net的多 模态阿尔茨海默病分类的跨模态合成

title: The use of PET in Alzheimer disease | Nature Reviews Neurology
title-short: PET在阿尔茨海默病中的应用|《自然评论神经病学 》

title: MRI to FDG-PET: Cross-Modal Synthesis Using 3D U-Net for Multi-modal Alzheimer’s Classification | SpringerLink
title-short: MRI到FDG-PET：使用3D U-Net进行 多模态阿尔茨海默病分类的跨模态合成|SpringerLink

abstract:
Multi-modality data convey complementary information that can be used to improve the accuracy of prediction models in disease diagnosis. However, effectively integrating multi-modality data remains a challenging problem, especially when the data are incomplete. For instance, more than half of the subjects in the Alzheimer's disease neuroimaging initiative (ADNI) database have no fluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography and cerebrospinal fluid data. Currently, there are two commonly used strategies to handle the problem of incomplete data: 1) discard samples having missing features; and 2) impute those missing values via specific techniques. In the first case, a significant amount of useful information is lost and, in the second case, additional noise and artifacts might be introduced into the data. Also, previous studies generally focus on the pairwise relationships among subjects, without considering their underlying complex (e.g., high-order) relationships. To address these issues, in this paper, we propose a multi-hypergraph learning method for dealing with incomplete multimodality data. Specifically, we first construct multiple hypergraphs to represent the high-order relationships among subjects by dividing them into several groups according to the availability of their data modalities. A hypergraph regularized transductive learning method is then applied to these groups for automatic diagnosis of brain diseases. Extensive evaluation of the proposed method using all subjects in the baseline ADNI database indicates that our method achieves promising results in AD/MCI classification, compared with the state-of-the-art methods.

【摘要翻译】多模态数据传达了可用于提高疾病诊断中预测模型准确性的补充信息。然而，有效整合多模态数据仍然是一个具有挑战性的问题，尤其是在数据不完整的情况下。例如，阿尔茨海默病神经成像倡议（ADNI）数据库中超过一半的受试者没有氟脱氧葡萄糖正电子发射断层扫描和脑脊液数据。目前，有两种常用的策略来处理不完整数据的问题：1）丢弃具有缺失特征的样本；以及2）通过特定技术估算那些缺失的值。在第一种情况下，丢失了大量有用的信息，在第二种情况下可能会在数据中引入额外的噪声和伪影。此外，先前的研究通常侧重于受试者之间的成对关系，而没有考虑其潜在的复杂（例如，高阶）关系。为了解决这些问题，本文提出了一种处理不完全多模态数据的多超图学习方法。具体来说，我们首先构建多个超图，根据受试者数据模态的可用性将其分为几组，以表示受试者之间的高阶关系。然后将超图正则化的转导学习方法应用于这些组，用于脑疾病的自动诊断。使用基线ADNI数据库中的所有受试者对所提出的方法进行了广泛的评估，表明与最先进的方法相比，我们的方法在AD/MCI分类方面取得了有希望的结果。
container-title: IEEE journal of biomedical and health informatics
title: Multi-hypergraph learning for incomplete multimodality data
title-short: 不完全多模态数据的多超图学习

abstract:
Alzheimer’s disease is a progressive neurodegenerative disease most often associated with memory deficits and cognitive decline, although less common clinical presentations are increasingly recognized. The cardinal pathological features of the disease have been known for more than one hundred years, and today the presence of these amyloid plaques and neurofibrillary tangles are still required for a pathological diagnosis. Alzheimer’s disease is the most common cause of dementia globally. There remain no effective treatment options for the great majority of patients, and the primary causes of the disease are unknown except in a small number of familial cases driven by genetic mutations. Confounding efforts to develop effective diagnostic tools and disease-modifying therapies is the realization that Alzheimer’s disease is a mixed proteinopathy (amyloid and tau) frequently associated with other age-related processes such as cerebrovascular disease and Lewy body disease. Defining the relationships between and interdependence of various co-pathologies remains an active area of investigation. This review outlines etiologically-linked pathologic features of Alzheimer’s disease, as well as those that are inevitable findings of uncertain significance, such as granulovacuolar degeneration and Hirano bodies. Other disease processes that are frequent, but not inevitable, are also discussed, including pathologic processes that can clinically mimic Alzheimer’s disease. These include cerebrovascular disease, Lewy body disease, TDP-43 proteinopathies and argyrophilic grain disease. The purpose of this review is to provide an overview of Alzheimer’s disease pathology, its defining pathologic substrates and the related pathologies that can affect diagnosis and treatment.

【摘要翻译】阿尔茨海默病是一种进行性神经退行性疾病，通常与记忆缺陷和认知能力下降有关，尽管不太常见的临床表现越来越被认可。这种疾病的基本病理特征已经知道一百多年了，今天这些淀粉样蛋白斑块和神经原纤维缠结的存在仍然是病理诊断所必需的。阿尔茨海默病是全球痴呆症最常见的病因。对于绝大多数患者来说，仍然没有有效的治疗选择，除了少数由基因突变引起的家族性病例外，该疾病的主要原因尚不清楚。开发有效诊断工具和疾病改良疗法的努力令人困惑的是，人们意识到阿尔茨海默病是一种混合蛋白病（淀粉样蛋白和tau蛋白），经常与其他与年龄相关的过程有关，如脑血管病和路易体病。定义各种共病之间的关系和相互依存关系仍然是一个活跃的研究领域。这篇综述概述了阿尔茨海默病的病因相关病理特征，以及那些具有不确定意义的不可避免的发现，如颗粒细胞变性和平野体。还讨论了其他常见但并非不可避免的疾病过程，包括临床上可以模拟阿尔茨海默病的病理过程。其中包括脑血管病、路易体病、TDP-43蛋白病和嗜银性谷物病。这篇综述的目的是概述阿尔茨海默病的病理学、其定义的病理基础以及可能影响诊断和治疗的相关病理学。
title: The neuropathological diagnosis of Alzheimer’s disease
title-short: 阿尔茨海默病的神经病理学诊断

abstract:
Cognitive reserve (CR) is the brain’s capacity to cope with cerebral damage to minimize clinical manifestations. The ‘passive model’ considers head or brain measures as anatomical substrates of CR, whereas the ‘active model’ emphasizes the use of brain networks effectively. Sixteen healthy subjects, 12 amnestic mild cognitive impairment (MCI) and 16 cases with mild Alzheimer’s disease (AD) were included to investigate the relationships between proxies of CR and cerebral measures considered in the ‘passive’ and ‘active’ models. CR proxies were inferred premorbid IQ (WAIS Vocabulary test), ‘education–occupation’, a questionnaire of intellectual and social activities and a composite CR measure. MRI-derived whole-brain volumes and brain activity by functional MRI during a visual encoding task were obtained. Among healthy elders, higher CR was related to larger brains and reduced activity during cognitive processing, suggesting more effective use of cerebral networks. In contrast, higher CR was associated with reduced brain volumes in MCI and AD and increased brain function in the latter, indicating more advanced neuropathology but that active compensatory mechanisms are still at work in higher CR patients. The right superior temporal gyrus (BA 22) and the left superior parietal lobe (BA 7) showed greatest signiﬁcant differences in direction of slope with CR and activation between controls and AD cases. Finally, a regression analysis revealed that fMRI patterns were more closely related to CR proxies than brain volumes. Overall, inverse relationships for healthy and pathological aging groups emerged between brain structure and function and CR variables.

【摘要翻译】认知储备（CR）是大脑应对脑损伤以尽量减少临床表现的能力。“被动模型”将头部或大脑测量视为CR的解剖学基础，而“主动模型”则强调有效地使用大脑网络。纳入16名健康受试者、12名遗忘性轻度认知障碍（MCI）和16名轻度阿尔茨海默病（AD）患者，以研究CR指标与“被动”和“主动”模型中考虑的大脑测量之间的关系。CR指标是推断出患病前智商（WAIS词汇测试）、“教育-职业”、智力和社会活动问卷以及综合CR测量。在视觉编码任务期间，通过功能MRI获得MRI衍生的全脑体积和大脑活动。在健康的老年人中，较高的CR与较大的大脑和认知过程中活动减少有关，这表明大脑网络的使用更有效。相反，较高的CR与MCI和AD的脑容量减少以及后者的脑功能增加有关，这表明更先进的神经病理学，但在较高的CR患者中，积极的代偿机制仍在发挥作用。右颞上回（BA 22）和左顶叶上叶（BA 7）在CR和激活的斜坡方向上显示出对照组和AD病例之间最大的显著差异。最后，回归分析显示，功能磁共振成像模式与CR指标的关系比大脑体积更密切。总体而言，健康和病理衰老组的大脑结构和功能与CR变量之间出现了相反的关系。
title: Brain structure and function related to cognitive reserve variables in normal aging, mild cognitive impairment and Alzheimer's disease
title-short: 正常衰老、轻度认知障碍和阿尔茨海默病中与认知储备 变量相关的大脑结构和功能
