abstract:
Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) has become the most popular method for imaging brain function. Handbook of Functional MRI Data Analysis provides a comprehensive and practical introduction to the methods used for fMRI data analysis. Using minimal jargon, this book explains the concepts behind processing fMRI data, focusing on the techniques that are most commonly used in the field. This book provides background about the methods employed by common data analysis packages including FSL, SPM and AFNI. Some of the newest cutting-edge techniques, including pattern classification analysis, connectivity modeling and resting state network analysis, are also discussed. Readers of this book, whether newcomers to the field or experienced researchers, will obtain a deep and effective knowledge of how to employ fMRI analysis to ask scientific questions and become more sophisticated users of fMRI analysis software.

【摘要翻译】功能性磁共振成像（fMRI）已成为最流行的大脑功能成像方法。功能性MRI数据分析手册对功能性MRI的数据分析方法进行了全面而实用的介绍。这本书用最少的术语解释了处理fMRI数据背后的概念，重点介绍了该领域最常用的技术。本书提供了常见数据分析包（包括FSL、SPM和AFNI）所使用方法的背景知识。还讨论了一些最新的前沿技术，包括模式分类分析、连通性建模和静息状态网络分析。本书的读者，无论是该领域的新手还是经验丰富的研究人员，都将获得关于如何利用功能磁共振成像分析提出科学问题的深入而有效的知识，并成为功能磁共振分析软件的更复杂的用户。
title: Handbook of Functional MRI Data Analysis
title-short: 功能性MRI数据分析手册

title: Disentangling the individual-shared and individual-specific subspace of altered brain functional connectivity in autism spectrum disorder
title-short: 解开自闭症谱系障碍中大脑功能连接改变的个体共享和 个体特定子空间

abstract:
Alzheimer’s disease constitutes a progressive neurodegenerative ailment chiefly characterised by memory impairment and cognitive deterioration. With an annual global incidence of ten million new cases, it imposes a substantial strain on individual, familial, and societal financial resources and healthcare infrastructure. Ascertaining a precise diagnosis becomes paramount. To tackle this challenge, we proffer a multifaceted deep learning architecture, aimed at simultaneously achieving neuroimaging synthesis and disease classification. Concurrently, we employ the SHapley Additive exPlanations (SHAP) and statistical differential analysis methodologies to delineate the contributions of both clinical and imaging attributes to the classification model, thus elucidating the salient cerebral regions implicated in the disease’s progression. Finally, we validate structural distinctions within these pivotal brain regions employing Voxelbased Morphometry (VBM). The test results, obtained from the Alzheimer’s Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI-1/2) dataset, attest to the exceptional performance of our approach in the domains of neuroimaging synthesis and classification evaluation metrics. By amalgamating SHAP and VBM analyses, we illuminate the repercussions of Alzheimer’s disease on the imaging characteristics of specific cerebral regions and the complexity of brain networks, thereby accentuating the profound utility of deep learning in delving into multimodal data and exploring the pathological mechanisms underpinning Alzheimer’s disease. Simultaneously, we augment the interpretability and transparency of our model, thus bolstering its credibility. Our research underscores the urgency and significance of precise Alzheimer’s disease diagnosis. Our proposed multifaceted deep learning framework, coupled with advanced analytical techniques, contributes substantively to neuroimaging synthesis and classification, thereby providing vital support for the enhanced comprehension, diagnosis, and treatment of this condition.

【摘要翻译】阿尔茨海默病是一种进行性神经退行性疾病，主要以记忆障碍和认知退化为特征。全球每年新增病例1000万例，这给个人、家庭和社会财政资源以及医疗基础设施带来了巨大压力。确定准确的诊断变得至关重要。为了应对这一挑战，我们提供了一个多方面的深度学习架构，旨在同时实现神经成像合成和疾病分类。同时，我们使用SHapley加性分析（SHAP）和统计差异分析方法来描述临床和成像属性对分类模型的贡献，从而阐明与疾病进展有关的显著大脑区域。最后，我们使用基于Voxelbased Morphometry（VBM）来验证这些关键大脑区域内的结构差异。从阿尔茨海默病神经成像倡议（ADNI-1/2）数据集获得的测试结果证明了我们的方法在神经成像合成和分类评估指标领域的卓越性能。通过合并SHAP和VBM分析，我们阐明了阿尔茨海默病对特定大脑区域成像特征和大脑网络复杂性的影响，从而强调了深度学习在深入研究多模式数据和探索阿尔茨海默病的病理机制方面的深远作用。同时，我们增强了模型的可解释性和透明度，从而增强了其可信度。我们的研究强调了精确诊断阿尔茨海默病的紧迫性和重要性。我们提出的多方面深度学习框架，加上先进的分析技术，对神经成像的合成和分类做出了实质性贡献，从而为增强对这种疾病的理解、诊断和治疗提供了重要支持。
title: Neuroimaging Synthesis and Classification for Alzheimer's Disease Based on Multi-task Deep Learning Framework and SHAP Analysis
title-short: 基于多任务深度学习框架和SHAP分析的阿尔茨海默 病神经影像学综合与分类

title: Neuroimaging Synthesis and Classification for Alzheimer's Disease Based on Multi-task Deep Learning Framework and SHAP Analysis
title-short: 基于多任务深度学习框架和SHAP分析的阿尔茨海默 病神经影像学综合与分类

abstract:
Alzheimer’s disease, a progressive neurodegenerative condition, is marked by cognitive decline and memory loss. Annual cases exceed ten million, imposing a substantial burden on individuals, families, and healthcare systems. Accurate diagnosis is crucial. To tackle this issue, we introduce a task-integrated deep learning framework for neuroimaging synthesis and disease classification. SHapley Additive exPlanations (SHAP) and statistical differential analysis are employed to assess the contributions of clinical and imaging attributes to the classification model, emphasizing impacted brain regions. Voxel-based Morphometry (VBM) is utilized to substantiate structural disparities in these regions. Test results from the Alzheimer’s Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) dataset showcase our approach’s exceptional performance in neuroimaging synthesis and classification evaluation metrics. By integrating SHAP and VBM analyses, we illuminate Alzheimer’s effects on specific cerebral region imaging characteristics and brain network complexity, highlighting deep learning’s efficacy in multimodal data exploration and pathological mechanism understanding. Our model prioritises interpretability and transparency, enhancing its credibility. Our research underscores the urgency and significance of precise Alzheimer’s diagnosis. Our proposed framework, coupled with advanced analytical techniques, significantly contributes to neuroimaging synthesis and classification, facilitating improved comprehension, diagnosis, and treatment of this condition.

【摘要翻译】阿尔茨海默病是一种进行性神经退行性疾病，其特征是认知能力下降和记忆力丧失。年病例超过1000万，给个人、家庭和医疗系统带来了巨大负担。准确的诊断至关重要。为了解决这个问题，我们引入了一个用于神经成像合成和疾病分类的任务集成深度学习框架。SHapley加性预测（SHAP）和统计差异分析用于评估临床和成像属性对分类模型的贡献，强调受影响的大脑区域。基于体素的形态计量学（VBM）被用来证实这些区域的结构差异。阿尔茨海默病神经成像倡议（ADNI）数据集的测试结果展示了我们的方法在神经成像合成和分类评估指标方面的卓越性能。通过整合SHAP和VBM分析，我们阐明了阿尔茨海默病对特定大脑区域成像特征和大脑网络复杂性的影响，强调了深度学习在多模式数据探索和病理机制理解方面的功效。我们的模型优先考虑可解释性和透明度，从而提高其可信度。我们的研究强调了精确诊断阿尔茨海默氏症的紧迫性和重要性。我们提出的框架，加上先进的分析技术，有助于神经影像学的合成和分类，促进对这种疾病的理解、诊断和治疗。
title: Neuroimaging Synthesis and Classification for Alzheimer's Disease Based on Multi-task Deep Learning Framework and SHAP Analysis

abstract:
Comparing the brains of related species faces the challenges of establishing homologies whilst accommodating evolutionary specializations. Here we propose a general framework for understanding similarities and differences between the brains of primates. The approach uses white matter blueprints of the whole cortex based on a set of white matter tracts that can be anatomically matched across species. The blueprints provide a common reference space that allows us to navigate between brains of different species, identify homologous cortical areas, or to transform whole cortical maps from one species to the other. Specializations are cast within this framework as deviations between the species’ blueprints. We illustrate how this approach can be used to compare human and macaque brains.

【摘要翻译】比较相关物种的大脑面临着在适应进化专业化的同时建立同源性的挑战。在这里，我们提出了一个理解灵长类动物大脑异同的通用框架。该方法使用了基于一组白质束的整个皮层的白质蓝图，这些白质束可以在不同物种之间进行解剖学匹配。蓝图提供了一个共同的参考空间，使我们能够在不同物种的大脑之间导航，识别同源皮层区域，或将整个皮层地图从一个物种转换到另一个物种。在这个框架内，专业化被视为物种蓝图之间的偏差。我们展示了如何使用这种方法来比较人类和猕猴的大脑。
title: Whole brain comparative anatomy using connectivity blueprints
title-short: 使用连接蓝图的全脑比较解剖学

abstract:
How the evolution of speech has transformed the human auditory cortex compared to other primates remains largely unknown. While primary auditory cortex is organized largely similarly in humans and macaques,1 the picture is much less clear at higher levels of the anterior auditory pathway,2 particularly regarding the processing of conspecific vocalizations (CVs). A “voice region” similar to the human voice-selective areas3,4 has been identified in the macaque right anterior temporal lobe with functional MRI;5 however, its anatomical localization, seemingly inconsistent with that of the human temporal voice areas (TVAs), has suggested a “repositioning of the voice area” in recent human evolution.6 Here we report a functional homology in the cerebral processing of vocalizations by macaques and humans, using comparative fMRI and a condition-rich auditory stimulation paradigm. We find that the anterior temporal lobe of both species possesses cortical voice areas that are bilateral and not only prefer conspecific vocalizations but also implement a representational geometry categorizing them apart from all other sounds in a species-specific but homologous manner. These results reveal a more similar functional organization of higher-level auditory cortex in macaques and humans than currently known.

【摘要翻译】与其他灵长类动物相比，言语的进化是如何改变人类听觉皮层的，这在很大程度上是未知的。虽然人类和猕猴的初级听觉皮层组织基本相似，1但在前听觉通路的较高水平上，情况就不那么清楚了，2尤其是在同种发声（CV）的处理方面。功能性MRI在猕猴右前颞叶发现了一个类似于人声选择区3、4的“声音区”；5然而，它的解剖定位似乎与人类颞音区（TVA）的解剖定位不一致，这表明在最近的人类进化中“音区的重新定位”。6在这里，我们使用比较功能磁共振成像和条件丰富的听觉刺激范式，报告了猕猴和人类在大脑发声过程中的功能同源性。我们发现，这两个物种的前颞叶都有双侧的皮层发声区域，不仅喜欢同种发声，而且实现了一种代表性的几何结构，以物种特异但同源的方式将它们与所有其他声音区分开来。这些结果揭示了猕猴和人类高级听觉皮层的功能组织比目前已知的更相似。
title: Functionally homologous representation of vocalizations in the auditory cortex of humans and macaques
title-short: 人类和猕猴听觉皮层发声的功能同源性表征

abstract:
Resting state functional connectivity MRI (rs-fcMRI) may provide a powerful and noninvasive “bridge” for comparing brain function between patients and experimental animal models; however, the relationship between human and macaque rs-fcMRI remains poorly understood. Here, using a novel surface deformation process for species comparisons in the same anatomical space (, ), we found high correspondence, but also unique hub topology, between human and macaque functional connectomes. The global functional connectivity match between species was moderate to strong (r = 0.41) and increased when considering the top 15% strongest connections (r = 0.54). Analysis of the match between functional connectivity and the underlying anatomical connectivity, derived from a previous retrograde tracer study done in macaques (), showed impressive structure–function correspondence in both the macaque and human. When examining the strongest structural connections, we found a 70–80% match between structural and functional connectivity matrices in both species. Finally, we compare species on two widely used metrics for studying hub topology: degree and betweenness centrality. The data showed topological agreement across the species, with nodes of the posterior cingulate showing high degree and betweenness centrality. In contrast, nodes in medial frontal and parietal cortices were identified as having high degree and betweenness in the human as opposed to the macaque. Our results provide: (1) a thorough examination and validation for a surface-based interspecies deformation process, (2) a strong theoretical foundation for making interspecies comparisons of rs-fcMRI, and (3) a unique look at topological distinctions between the species.

【摘要翻译】静息状态功能连接MRI（rs-fcMRI）可以为比较患者和实验动物模型之间的大脑功能提供一个强大且无创的“桥梁”；然而，人类和猕猴的fcMRI之间的关系仍然知之甚少。在这里，使用一种新的表面变形过程在同一解剖空间中进行物种比较（，），我们发现人类和猕猴功能连接体之间具有高度的对应性，但也具有独特的中枢拓扑结构。物种之间的整体功能连接匹配是中等到强烈的（r=0.41），当考虑到前15%的最强连接时（r=0.54），这种匹配会增加。对功能连接和潜在解剖连接之间匹配的分析，源于之前对猕猴进行的逆行示踪研究（），在猕猴和人类身上都显示出令人印象深刻的结构-功能对应关系。在研究最强的结构连接时，我们发现两个物种的结构和功能连接矩阵之间有70-80%的匹配。最后，我们在研究集线器拓扑的两个广泛使用的指标上比较了物种：度和介数中心性。数据显示，整个物种的拓扑一致，后扣带的节点显示出高度和介数中心性。相反，与猕猴相比，人类额叶和顶叶内侧皮质的结节具有高度和介数性。我们的结果提供了：（1）对基于表面的种间变形过程进行了彻底的检查和验证，（2）为进行rs-fcMRI的种间比较提供了强有力的理论基础，以及（3）对物种之间拓扑差异的独特见解。
title: Bridging the Gap between the Human and Macaque Connectome: A Quantitative Comparison of Global Interspecies Structure-Function Relationships and Network Topology

abstract:
Abstract
            Estimating the pose of multiple animals is a challenging computer vision problem: frequent interactions cause occlusions and complicate the association of detected keypoints to the correct individuals, as well as having highly similar looking animals that interact more closely than in typical multi-human scenarios. To take up this challenge, we build on DeepLabCut, an open-source pose estimation toolbox, and provide high-performance animal assembly and tracking—features required for multi-animal scenarios. Furthermore, we integrate the ability to predict an animal’s identity to assist tracking (in case of occlusions). We illustrate the power of this framework with four datasets varying in complexity, which we release to serve as a benchmark for future algorithm development.

【摘要翻译】摘要估计多只动物的姿势是一个具有挑战性的计算机视觉问题：频繁的互动会导致遮挡，并使检测到的关键点与正确个体的关联复杂化，此外，与典型的多人场景相比，长相高度相似的动物互动更紧密。为了应对这一挑战，我们在开源姿势估计工具箱DeepLabCut的基础上进行了构建，并提供了高性能的动物组装和跟踪——这是多动物场景所需的功能。此外，我们整合了预测动物身份的能力，以帮助跟踪（在闭塞的情况下）。我们用四个复杂度不同的数据集来说明这个框架的威力，我们发布这些数据集是为了作为未来算法开发的基准。
title: Multi-animal pose estimation, identification and tracking with DeepLabCut
title-short: 基于DeepLabCut的多动物姿态估计、识别与 跟踪

abstract:
Abstract
            The desire to understand how the brain generates and patterns behavior has driven rapid methodological innovation in tools to quantify natural animal behavior. While advances in deep learning and computer vision have enabled markerless pose estimation in individual animals, extending these to multiple animals presents unique challenges for studies of social behaviors or animals in their natural environments. Here we present Social LEAP Estimates Animal Poses (SLEAP), a machine learning system for multi-animal pose tracking. This system enables versatile workflows for data labeling, model training and inference on previously unseen data. SLEAP features an accessible graphical user interface, a standardized data model, a reproducible configuration system, over 30 model architectures, two approaches to part grouping and two approaches to identity tracking. We applied SLEAP to seven datasets across flies, bees, mice and gerbils to systematically evaluate each approach and architecture, and we compare it with other existing approaches. SLEAP achieves greater accuracy and speeds of more than 800 frames per second, with latencies of less than 3.5 ms at full 1,024 × 1,024 image resolution. This makes SLEAP usable for real-time applications, which we demonstrate by controlling the behavior of one animal on the basis of the tracking and detection of social interactions with another animal.

【摘要翻译】摘要了解大脑如何产生和模式行为的愿望推动了量化自然动物行为工具的快速方法创新。虽然深度学习和计算机视觉的进步使单个动物的姿势估计变得无标记，但将其扩展到多个动物，对研究自然环境中的社会行为或动物提出了独特的挑战。在这里，我们介绍了Social LEAP Estimates Animal Poses（SLEAP），这是一个用于多动物姿势跟踪的机器学习系统。该系统实现了对以前看不见的数据进行数据标记、模型训练和推理的多功能工作流程。SLEAP具有可访问的图形用户界面、标准化数据模型、可复制的配置系统、30多种模型架构、两种零件分组方法和两种身份跟踪方法。我们将SLEAP应用于苍蝇、蜜蜂、老鼠和沙鼠的七个数据集，以系统地评估每种方法和架构，并将其与其他现有方法进行比较。SLEAP实现了更高的精度和每秒800帧以上的速度，延迟小于3.5 满1024毫秒 × 1024图像分辨率。这使得SLEAP可用于实时应用，我们通过在跟踪和检测与另一只动物的社交互动的基础上控制一只动物，来证明这一点。
title: SLEAP: A deep learning system for multi-animal pose tracking
title-short: SLEAP：一种用于多动物姿态跟踪的深度学习系统

abstract:
The rhesus macaque is an important model species in several branches of science, including neuroscience, psychology, ethology, and medicine. The utility of the macaque model would be greatly enhanced by the ability to precisely measure behavior in freely moving conditions. Existing approaches do not provide sufficient tracking. Here, we describe OpenMonkeyStudio, a deep learning-based markerless motion capture system for estimating 3D pose in freely moving macaques in large unconstrained environments. Our system makes use of 62 machine vision cameras that encircle an open 2.45 m × 2.45 m × 2.75 m enclosure. The resulting multiview image streams allow for data augmentation via 3D-reconstruction of annotated images to train a robust view-invariant deep neural network. This view invariance represents an important advance over previous markerless 2D tracking approaches, and allows fully automatic pose inference on unconstrained natural motion. We show that OpenMonkeyStudio can be used to accurately recognize actions and track social interactions.

【摘要翻译】恒河猴是神经科学、心理学、行为学和医学等多个学科的重要模式物种。猕猴模型在自由移动条件下精确测量行为的能力将大大增强其实用性。现有的方法没有提供足够的跟踪。在这里，我们描述了OpenMonkeyStudio，这是一个基于深度学习的无标记运动捕捉系统，用于估计大型无约束环境中自由移动猕猴的3D姿势。我们的系统使用了62台机器视觉摄像机，它们包围着一个2.45的开口 m × 2.45 m × 2.75 m外壳。所得到的多视点图像流允许通过注释图像的3D重建来增强数据，以训练鲁棒的视点不变深度神经网络。这种视图不变性代表了对以前的无标记2D跟踪方法的重要进步，并允许对无约束自然运动进行全自动姿态推断。我们展示了OpenMonkeyStudio可以用于准确识别动作和跟踪社交互动。
title: Automated markerless pose estimation in freely moving macaques with OpenMonkeyStudio
title-short: 使用OpenMonkeyStudio自动估计自由 移动猕猴的无标记姿势

title: Deep-learning-based identification, tracking, pose estimation and behaviour classification of interacting primates and mice in complex environments
title-short: 基于深度学习的复杂环境中互动灵长类动物和小鼠的识 别、跟踪、姿态估计和行为分类

abstract:
Recently developed methods for video analysis, especially models for pose estimation and behavior classification, are transforming behavioral quantification to be more precise, scalable, and reproducible in fields such as neuroscience and ethology. These tools overcome long-standing limitations of manual scoring of video frames and traditional ‘center of mass’ tracking algorithms to enable video analysis at scale. The expansion of open-source tools for video acquisition and analysis has led to new experimental approaches to understand behavior. Here, we review currently available open-source tools for video analysis and discuss how to set up these methods for labs new to video recording. We also discuss best practices for developing and using video analysis methods, including community-wide standards and critical needs for the open sharing of datasets and code, more widespread comparisons of video analysis methods, and better documentation for these methods especially for new users. We encourage broader adoption and continued development of these tools, which have tremendous potential for accelerating scientific progress in understanding the brain and behavior.

【摘要翻译】最近开发的视频分析方法，特别是姿势估计和行为分类模型，正在将行为量化转变为在神经科学和行为学等领域更加精确、可扩展和可重复。这些工具克服了视频帧手动评分和传统的“质心”跟踪算法的长期局限性，实现了视频的大规模分析。用于视频采集和分析的开源工具的扩展导致了理解行为的新实验方法。在这里，我们回顾了目前可用的视频分析开源工具，并讨论了如何为视频记录新手实验室设置这些方法。我们还讨论了开发和使用视频分析方法的最佳实践，包括社区范围的标准和开放共享数据集和代码的关键需求，更广泛地比较视频分析方法，以及更好地记录这些方法，特别是为新用户记录。我们鼓励更广泛地采用和继续开发这些工具，这些工具在加速理解大脑和行为方面的科学进步方面具有巨大潜力。
title: Open-source tools for behavioral video analysis: Setup, methods, and best practices
title-short: 行为视频分析的开源工具：设置、方法和最佳实践

abstract: Objective: At present, the most important cross-species research method is to construct a homologous brain area control map based on the existing homologous sites. However, with the development of the individual, the cerebral cortex will expand irregularly, which affects the existing homologous sites on the individual. Based on this, a method of tracing white matter fiber bundles as a reference frame at the individual level was proposed to construct the connectivity fingerprints of human and macaque brain regions. Materials and Methods: A total of 10 human subjects and 10 rhesus monkey subjects were selected from open brain imaging data set. White matter fiber tracts were extracted from preprocessed data at individual level, the connection strength between brain regions and white matter fiber tracts was calculated, and the connectivity finger pattern was constructed. The kronbach α coefficient was used to calculate the consistency between individuals within species. The cosine-similarity was used to analyze the connectivity patterns of homologous brain regions of two species, and the results were verified by permutation test. Results: Within species, Broca's area (Broca44), Primary sensory area (S1), and Hippocampus (Hippoc)'s consistency coefficients were 0.636, 0.780, 0.977 in macaques, and in humans, the consistency coefficients were 0.781, 0.726, and 0.607. Among species, the cosine similarity calculation results of Broca44 area, S1 area, and Hippoc area were 0.979, 0.994, and 0.995. Conclusions: Tracing white matter fiber tracts at the individual level and constructing connectivity fingerprints for cross-species research between humans and macaques is effective, and this result supports the construction of a cross-species comparison framework between humans and macaques.
title: 基于DTI的人类与猕猴脑区连通性方法研究
title-short: 基于DTI的人类与猕猴脑区连通性方法研究

abstract:
‘Normal aging’ in the brain refers to age-related changes that occur independent of disease, in particular Alzheimer’s disease. A major barrier to mapping normal brain aging has been the difficulty in excluding the earliest preclinical stages of Alzheimer’s disease. Here, before addressing this issue we first imaged a mouse model and learn that the best MRI measure of dendritic spine loss, a known pathophysiological driver of normal aging, is one that relies on the combined use of functional and structural MRI. In the primary study, we then deployed the combined functional-structural MRI measure to investigate over 100 cognitively-normal people from 20–72 years of age. Next, to cover the tail end of aging, in secondary analyses we investigated structural MRI acquired from cognitively-normal people, 60–84 years of age, who were Alzheimer’s-free via biomarkers. Collectively, the results from the primary functional-structural study, and the secondary structural studies revealed that the dentate gyrus is a hippocampal region differentially affected by aging, and that the entorhinal cortex is a region most resistant to aging. Across the cortex, the primary functional-structural study revealed and that the inferior frontal gyrus is differentially affected by aging, however, the secondary structural studies implicated other frontal cortex regions. Together, the results clarify how normal aging may affect the brain and has possible mechanistic and therapeutic implications.

【摘要翻译】大脑中的“正常衰老”是指与年龄相关的变化，这些变化与疾病无关，尤其是阿尔茨海默病。绘制正常大脑衰老图的一个主要障碍是难以排除阿尔茨海默病的最早临床前阶段。在这里，在解决这个问题之前，我们首先对小鼠模型进行了成像，并了解到树突棘丢失（一种已知的正常衰老的病理生理驱动因素）的最佳MRI测量方法是依赖于功能和结构MRI的联合使用。在初步研究中，我们采用了功能-结构组合MRI测量方法，对100多名20-72岁的认知正常人进行了调查。接下来，为了涵盖衰老的末端，在二次分析中，我们研究了通过生物标志物从60-84岁的认知正常人身上获得的结构MRI，这些人没有阿尔茨海默氏症。总的来说，初级功能结构研究和次级结构研究的结果表明，齿状回是一个受衰老影响不同的海马区域，内嗅皮层是最耐衰老的区域。在整个皮层中，初级功能结构研究揭示了额下回受衰老的不同影响，然而，次级结构研究涉及其他额叶皮层区域。总之，这些结果阐明了正常衰老如何影响大脑，并可能具有机制和治疗意义。
title: Brain regions vulnerable and resistant to aging without Alzheimer’s disease
title-short: 没有阿尔茨海默病的易受衰老影响和抵抗衰老的大脑区 域

abstract:
Normal aging and Alzheimer’s disease (AD) cause profound changes in the brain’s structure and function. AD in particular is accompanied by widespread cortical neuronal loss, and loss of connections between brain systems. This degeneration of neural pathways disrupts the functional coherence of brain activation. Recent innovations in brain imaging have detected characteristic disruptions in functional networks. Here we review studies examining changes in functional connectivity, measured through fMRI (functional magnetic resonance imaging), starting with healthy aging and then Alzheimer’s disease. We cover studies that employ the three primary methods to analyze functional connectivity—seed-based, ICA (independent components analysis), and graph theory. At the end we include a brief discussion of other methodologies, such as EEG (electroencephalography), MEG (magnetoencephalography), and PET (positron emission tomography). We also describe multi-modal studies that combine rsfMRI (resting state fMRI) with PET imaging, as well as studies examining the effects of medications. Overall, connectivity and network integrity appear to decrease in healthy aging, but this decrease is accelerated in AD, with specific systems hit hardest, such as the default mode network (DMN). Functional connectivity is a relatively new topic of research, but it holds great promise in revealing how brain network dynamics change across the lifespan and in disease.

【摘要翻译】正常衰老和阿尔茨海默病（AD）会导致大脑结构和功能发生深刻变化。AD尤其伴随着广泛的皮层神经元损失，以及大脑系统之间的连接丧失。这种神经通路的退化破坏了大脑激活的功能连贯性。最近在大脑成像方面的创新发现了功能网络中的特征性破坏。在这里，我们回顾了通过功能磁共振成像（fMRI）测量的功能连接变化的研究，从健康衰老开始，然后是阿尔茨海默病。我们涵盖了使用三种主要方法来分析函数连通性的研究——基于种子的、ICA（独立分量分析）和图论。最后，我们简要讨论了其他方法，如脑电图（EEG）、脑磁图（MEG）和正电子发射断层扫描（PET）。我们还描述了将rsfMRI（静息状态fMRI）与PET成像相结合的多模式研究，以及检查药物效果的研究。总体而言，连接和网络完整性似乎在健康老化中下降，但这种下降在AD中加速，特定系统受到的打击最为严重，如默认模式网络（DMN）。功能连接是一个相对较新的研究课题，但它在揭示大脑网络动力学在寿命和疾病中的变化方面有很大的前景。
title: Functional Brain Connectivity Using fMRI in Aging and Alzheimer’s Disease
title-short: 功能性脑连接功能磁共振成像在老龄化和阿尔茨海默病 中的应用

abstract:
Working memory, a fundamental cognitive function that is highly dependent on the integrity of the prefrontal cortex, is known to show age-related decline across the typical healthy adult lifespan. Moreover, we know from work in neurophysiology that the prefrontal cortex is disproportionately susceptibly to the pathological effects of aging. The n-back task is arguably the most ubiquitous cognitive task for investigating working memory performance. Many functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) studies examine brain regions engaged during performance of the n-back task in adults. The current meta-analyses are the first to examine concordance and age-related changes across the healthy adult lifespan in brain areas engaged when performing the n-back task. We compile data from eligible fMRI articles that report stereotaxic coordinates of brain activity from healthy adults in three age-groups: young (23.57 ± 5.63 years), middle-aged (38.13 ± 5.63 years) and older (66.86 ± 5.70 years) adults. Findings show that the three groups share concordance in the engagement of parietal and cingulate cortices, which have been consistently identified as core areas involved in working memory; as well as the insula, claustrum, and cerebellum, which have not been highlighted as areas involved in working memory. Critically, prefrontal cortex engagement is concordant for young, to a lesser degree for middle-aged adults, and absent in older adults, suggesting a gradual linear decline in concordance of prefrontal cortex engagement. Our results provide important new knowledge for improving methodology and theories of cognition across the lifespan.

【摘要翻译】工作记忆是一种基本的认知功能，高度依赖于前额叶皮层的完整性，众所周知，在典型的健康成年人寿命中，工作记忆会随着年龄的增长而下降。此外，我们从神经生理学的研究中知道，前额叶皮层对衰老的病理影响的敏感性不成比例。n-back任务可以说是研究工作记忆表现的最普遍的认知任务。许多功能性磁共振成像（fMRI）研究检查了成年人在执行n-back任务时参与的大脑区域。目前的荟萃分析首次检验了健康成年人在执行n背任务时大脑区域的一致性和与年龄相关的变化。我们收集了符合条件的fMRI文章中的数据，这些文章报告了三个年龄组的健康成年人大脑活动的立体定位坐标：年轻人（23.57 ± 5.63岁），中年（38.13岁 ± 5.63岁）及以上（66.86 ± 5.70岁）成年人。研究结果表明，这三组人在顶叶和扣带皮层的参与方面具有一致性，这两个区域一直被认为是工作记忆的核心区域；以及脑岛、幽闭和小脑，它们尚未被强调为与工作记忆有关的区域。至关重要的是，年轻人的前额叶皮层参与是一致的，中年人的程度较低，老年人则没有，这表明前额叶皮层的参与一致性逐渐线性下降。我们的研究结果为改进整个生命周期的认知方法和理论提供了重要的新知识。
title: Meta-analyses of the n-back working memory task: fMRI evidence of age-related changes in prefrontal cortex involvement across the adult lifespan
title-short: n-背工作记忆任务的荟萃分析：成年期前额叶皮层参 与与年龄相关变化的fMRI证据

abstract:
Brain aging and associated neurodegeneration constitute a major societal challenge as well as one for the neuroimaging community. A full understanding of the physiological mechanisms underlying neurodegeneration still eludes medical researchers, fuelling the development of in vivo neuroimaging markers. Hence it is increasingly recognized that our understanding of neurodegenerative processes likely will depend upon the available information provided by imaging techniques. At the same time, the imaging techniques are often developed in response to the desire to observe certain physiological processes. In this context, functional MRI (fMRI), which has for decades provided information on neuronal activity, has evolved into a large family of techniques well suited for in vivo observations of brain physiology. Given the rapid technical advances in fMRI in recent years, this review aims to summarize the physiological basis of fMRI observations in healthy aging as well as in age-related neurodegeneration. This review focuses on in-vivo human brain imaging studies in this review and on disease features that can be imaged using fMRI methods. In addition to providing detailed literature summaries, this review also discusses future directions in the study of brain physiology using fMRI in the clinical setting.

【摘要翻译】大脑老化和相关的神经退行性变是一个重大的社会挑战，也是神经影像学界面临的挑战。医学研究人员仍然无法充分了解神经退行性变的生理机制，这推动了体内神经成像标记物的开发。因此，人们越来越认识到，我们对神经退行性过程的理解可能取决于成像技术提供的可用信息。同时，成像技术通常是根据观察某些生理过程的愿望而开发的。在这种情况下，几十年来一直提供神经元活动信息的功能性MRI（fMRI）已经发展成为一大类技术，非常适合于大脑生理学的体内观察。鉴于近年来功能磁共振成像技术的快速发展，本综述旨在总结功能磁共振在健康衰老和年龄相关神经退行性变中观察的生理基础。这篇综述的重点是体内人脑成像研究，以及可以使用功能磁共振成像方法成像的疾病特征。除了提供详细的文献摘要外，这篇综述还讨论了在临床环境中使用fMRI研究大脑生理学的未来方向。
title: Functional MRI of brain physiology in aging and neurodegenerative diseases
title-short: 衰老和神经退行性疾病的脑生理功能MRI

abstract:
Surface-based morphometry (SBM) is extremely useful for estimating the indices of cortical morphology, such as volume, thickness, area, and gyrification, whereas voxel-based morphometry (VBM) is a typical method of gray matter (GM) volumetry that includes cortex measurement. In cases where SBM is used to estimate cortical morphology, it remains controversial as to whether VBM should be used in addition to estimate GM volume. Therefore, this review has two main goals. First, we summarize the differences between the two methods regarding preprocessing, statistical analysis, and reliability. Second, we review studies that estimate cortical morphological changes using VBM and/or SBM and discuss whether using VBM in conjunction with SBM produces additional values. We found cases in which detection of morphological change in either VBM or SBM was superior, and others that showed equivalent performance between the two methods. Therefore, we concluded that using VBM and SBM together can help researchers and clinicians obtain a better understanding of normal neurobiological processes of the brain. Moreover, the use of both methods may improve the accuracy of the detection of morphological changes when comparing the data of patients and controls.In addition, we introduce two other recent methods as future directions for estimating cortical morphological changes: a multi-modal parcellation method using structural and functional images, and a synthetic segmentation method using multi-contrast images (such as T1- and proton density-weighted images).

【摘要翻译】基于表面的形态计量学（SBM）对于估计皮层形态的指标（如体积、厚度、面积和回转）非常有用，而基于体素的形态计量术（VBM）是一种典型的灰质（GM）体积测量方法，包括皮层测量。在SBM用于估计皮层形态的情况下，除了估计GM体积外，是否还应使用VBM仍存在争议。因此，本次审查有两个主要目标。首先，我们总结了两种方法在预处理、统计分析和可靠性方面的差异。其次，我们回顾了使用VBM和/或SBM估计皮层形态学变化的研究，并讨论了将VBM与SBM结合使用是否会产生额外的值。我们发现，在VBM或SBM中，对形态学变化的检测效果更好，而在其他情况下，这两种方法的性能相当。因此，我们得出结论，将VBM和SBM结合使用可以帮助研究人员和临床医生更好地了解大脑的正常神经生物学过程。此外，在比较患者和对照组的数据时，使用这两种方法可以提高形态学变化检测的准确性。此外，我们还介绍了另外两种最新的方法作为估计皮层形态变化的未来方向：一种是使用结构和功能图像的多模态分割方法，另一种是利用多对比度图像（如T1和质子密度加权图像）的合成分割方法。
note: 🏷️ /unread、Humans、Magnetic Resonance Imaging、Brain、confounding covariate、cortex volume、Gray Matter、Reproducibility of Results、smoothing、surface-based morphometry、voxel-based morphometry
title: Advantages of Using Both Voxel- and Surface-based Morphometry in Cortical Morphology Analysis: A Review of Various Applications
title-short: 在皮质形态学分析中同时使用基于体素和表面的形态测 量的优势：各种应用综述

abstract:
Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) has become the most popular method for imaging brain function. Handbook of Functional MRI Data Analysis provides a comprehensive and practical introduction to the methods used for fMRI data analysis. Using minimal jargon, this book explains the concepts behind processing fMRI data, focusing on the techniques that are most commonly used in the field. This book provides background about the methods employed by common data analysis packages including FSL, SPM and AFNI. Some of the newest cutting-edge techniques, including pattern classification analysis, connectivity modeling and resting state network analysis, are also discussed. Readers of this book, whether newcomers to the field or experienced researchers, will obtain a deep and effective knowledge of how to employ fMRI analysis to ask scientific questions and become more sophisticated users of fMRI analysis software.

【摘要翻译】功能性磁共振成像（fMRI）已成为最流行的大脑功能成像方法。功能性MRI数据分析手册对功能性MRI的数据分析方法进行了全面而实用的介绍。这本书用最少的术语解释了处理fMRI数据背后的概念，重点介绍了该领域最常用的技术。本书提供了常见数据分析包（包括FSL、SPM和AFNI）所使用方法的背景知识。还讨论了一些最新的前沿技术，包括模式分类分析、连通性建模和静息状态网络分析。本书的读者，无论是该领域的新手还是经验丰富的研究人员，都将获得关于如何利用功能磁共振成像分析提出科学问题的深入而有效的知识，并成为功能磁共振分析软件的更复杂的用户。
title: Handbook of Functional MRI Data Analysis
title-short: 功能性MRI数据分析手册

abstract:
Our brain is a network. It consists of spatially distributed, but functionally linked regions that continuously share information with each other. Int…

title: Exploring the brain network: A review on resting-state fMRI functional connectivity
title-short: 探索大脑网络：静息状态fMRI功能连接综述
